description: PullRequestGenerator defines a generator that scrapes a PullRequest API to find candidate pull requests.

bitbucketServer.description: PullRequestGenerator defines connection info specific to BitbucketServer.

api.description: The Bitbucket REST API URL to talk to e.g. https://bitbucket.org/rest Required.

basicAuth.description: BasicAuthBitbucketServer defines the username/(password or personal access token) for Basic auth.

passwordRef.description: Utility struct for a reference to a secret key.

filters.description: Filters for which pull requests should be considered.

items.description:
PullRequestGeneratorFilter is a single pull request filter.
If multiple filter types are set on a single struct, they will be AND'd together. All filters must
pass for a pull request to be included.

gitea.description: PullRequestGenerator defines connection info specific to Gitea.

api.title: The Gitea API URL to talk to. Required

insecure.description: Allow insecure tls, for self-signed certificates; default: false.

owner.description: Gitea org or user to scan. Required.

repo.description: Gitea repo name to scan. Required.

tokenRef.description: Utility struct for a reference to a secret key.

github.description: PullRequestGenerator defines connection info specific to GitHub.

api.description: The GitHub API URL to talk to. If blank, use https://api.github.com/.

appSecretName.description: AppSecretName is a reference to a GitHub App repo-creds secret with permission to access pull requests.

labels.title: Labels is used to filter the PRs that you want to target

owner.description: GitHub org or user to scan. Required.

repo.description: GitHub repo name to scan. Required.

tokenRef.description: Utility struct for a reference to a secret key.

gitlab.description: PullRequestGeneratorGitLab defines connection info specific to GitLab.

api.description: The GitLab API URL to talk to. If blank, uses https://gitlab.com/.

labels.title: Labels is used to filter the MRs that you want to target

pullRequestState.title: PullRequestState is an additional MRs filter to get only those with a certain state. Default: "" (all states)

tokenRef.description: Utility struct for a reference to a secret key.

metadata.title:
ApplicationSetTemplateMeta represents the Argo CD application fields that may
be used for Applications generated from the ApplicationSet (based on metav1.ObjectMeta)

spec.description: ApplicationSpec represents desired application state. Contains link to repository with application definition and additional parameters link definition revision.

destination.title: ApplicationDestination holds information about the application's destination

name.title: Name is an alternate way of specifying the target cluster by its symbolic name

namespace.title:
Namespace specifies the target namespace for the application's resources.
The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace

server.title: Server specifies the URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API

ignoreDifferences.title: IgnoreDifferences is a list of resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison

items.description: ResourceIgnoreDifferences contains resource filter and list of json paths which should be ignored during comparison with live state.

managedFieldsManagers.title:
ManagedFieldsManagers is a list of trusted managers. Fields mutated by those managers will take precedence over the
desired state defined in the SCM and won't be displayed in diffs

info.title: Info contains a list of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application

project.description:
Project is a reference to the project this application belongs to.
The empty string means that application belongs to the 'default' project.

revisionHistoryLimit.description:
RevisionHistoryLimit limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions.
This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances.
Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used.
Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it.
Default is 10.

source.title: ApplicationSource contains all required information about the source of an application

chart.description: Chart is a Helm chart name, and must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

directory.title: ApplicationSourceDirectory holds options for applications of type plain YAML or Jsonnet

exclude.title: Exclude contains a glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation

include.title: Include contains a glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation

jsonnet.title: ApplicationSourceJsonnet holds options specific to applications of type Jsonnet

extVars.title: ExtVars is a list of Jsonnet External Variables

items.title: JsonnetVar represents a variable to be passed to jsonnet during manifest generation

tlas.title: TLAS is a list of Jsonnet Top-level Arguments

items.title: JsonnetVar represents a variable to be passed to jsonnet during manifest generation

recurse.title: Recurse specifies whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests

fileParameters.title: FileParameters are file parameters to the helm template

items.title: HelmFileParameter is a file parameter that's passed to helm template during manifest generation

name.title: Name is the name of the Helm parameter

path.title: Path is the path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter

ignoreMissingValueFiles.title: IgnoreMissingValueFiles prevents helm template from failing when valueFiles do not exist locally by not appending them to helm template --values

parameters.title: Parameters is a list of Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation

items.title: HelmParameter is a parameter that's passed to helm template during manifest generation

forceString.title: ForceString determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings

name.title: Name is the name of the Helm parameter

value.title: Value is the value for the Helm parameter

passCredentials.title: PassCredentials pass credentials to all domains (Helm's --pass-credentials)

releaseName.title: ReleaseName is the Helm release name to use. If omitted it will use the application name

skipCrds.title: SkipCrds skips custom resource definition installation step (Helm's --skip-crds)

valueFiles.title: ValuesFiles is a list of Helm value files to use when generating a template

values.title: Values specifies Helm values to be passed to helm template, typically defined as a block

version.title: Version is the Helm version to use for templating ("3")

kustomize.title: ApplicationSourceKustomize holds options specific to an Application source specific to Kustomize

commonAnnotations.title: CommonAnnotations is a list of additional annotations to add to rendered manifests

commonLabels.title: CommonLabels is a list of additional labels to add to rendered manifests

forceCommonAnnotations.title: ForceCommonAnnotations specifies whether to force applying common annotations to resources for Kustomize apps

forceCommonLabels.title: ForceCommonLabels specifies whether to force applying common labels to resources for Kustomize apps

images.title: Images is a list of Kustomize image override specifications

namePrefix.title: NamePrefix is a prefix appended to resources for Kustomize apps

nameSuffix.title: NameSuffix is a suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps

version.title: Version controls which version of Kustomize to use for rendering manifests

path.description: Path is a directory path within the Git repository, and is only valid for applications sourced from Git.

plugin.title: ApplicationSourcePlugin holds options specific to config management plugins

items.title: EnvEntry represents an entry in the application's environment

name.title: Name is the name of the variable, usually expressed in uppercase

value.title: Value is the value of the variable

repoURL.title: RepoURL is the URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests

targetRevision.description:
TargetRevision defines the revision of the source to sync the application to.
In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD.
In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

syncPolicy.title: SyncPolicy controls when a sync will be performed in response to updates in git

automated.title: SyncPolicyAutomated controls the behavior of an automated sync

allowEmpty.title: AllowEmpty allows apps have zero live resources (default: false)

prune.title: Prune specifies whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync (default: false)

selfHeal.title: SelfHeal specifes whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster (default: false)

retry.title: RetryStrategy contains information about the strategy to apply when a sync failed

backoff.title: Backoff is the backoff strategy to use on subsequent retries for failing syncs

duration.title: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. "2m", "1h")

factor.title: Factor is a factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry

maxDuration.title: MaxDuration is the maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy

limit.description: Limit is the maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

syncOptions.title: Options allow you to specify whole app sync-options
